thread.title: Patriots players' kids stayed up late to help their dads celebrate a Super Bowl victory
thread.title_full: Patriots players' kids stayed up late to help their dads celebrate a Super Bowl victory

title: Patriots players' kids stayed up late to help their dads celebrate a Super Bowl victory
text:
As the Patriots secured an historic Super Bowl victory Sunday night, Tom Brady and other players were cheered on by their biggest fans–their kids.
Brady, Martellus Bennett, and other members of the Patriots roster were joined in Houston for Super Bowl 51 by their children, and they celebrated the championship comeback with their kids by their sides. From interrupted post-game press conferences to heartfelt social media snaps, Pats players proved that their Super Bowl win was truly a family affair.
After the Patriots’ victory, Brady broke down in tears, hugging wife Gisele Bündchen and daughter Vivian, who wore a TB12 jersey in support of her dad.
Tom Brady gets a hug from his wife, Gisele Bundchen as his daughter, Vivian Lake Brady looks on. —Larry W. Smith / EPA Later, he posted a family photo on Instagram.
It takes a team. And so much love. #NeverStopBelieving
A photo posted by Tom Brady (@tombrady) on Feb 5, 2017 at 10:15pm PST
The picture was accompanied by a sweet message: “It takes a team. And so much love. #NeverStopBelieving.”
Patrick Chung shared an adorable snap of his son holding the Lombardi Trophy, captioned: “Reason for my being!”
Reason for my being!
A photo posted by Patrick Chung (@23patrickchung) on Feb 5, 2017 at 10:22pm PST
Bennett’s daughter crashed his postgame presser, where she had a lot to say about her friends and her dog, Wendy.
Marty's daughter is fielding questions about her dog Wendy pic.twitter.com/Jug5kuNivD
— Charlotte Wilder (@TheWilderThings) February 6, 2017
Bennett said during the presser that his greatest accomplishment, above all else, is being a dad. He later shared a photo of the two celebrating together on the field after the win.
Champions….
A photo posted by Martellus Bennett (@martellusb) on Feb 6, 2017 at 1:46am PST
LeGarrette Blount’s two children also joined him for a post-game press conference. Among other things, they praised Super Bowl MVP Brady–just as Blount had done right after the game .
LeGarrette Blount and his kids talking about Tom Brady – the Goat. pic.twitter.com/fK3qMDoZcC
— Jonathan Hall (@JHall7news) February 6, 2017
Safety Duron Harmon, who predicted the Patriots’ historic comeback at halftime, had some company at his presser as well. With his son on his lap, Harmon spoke to reporters, referring to Tom Brady as the “Michael Jordan of football.”
Duron Harmon: We have Tom Brady, the Michael Jordan of football pic.twitter.com/PJSNOxd2jV
— Ryan Hannable (@RyanHannable) February 6, 2017
